Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: Elman1952
Reviews.Content: We went to NYC for a long weekend and because of the time of year, the hotels were booked solid, so we tried here in order to get a price we could afford. The staff was friendly and efficient, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable. However, the room, even by NYC standards was TINY! There was litterally one foot (12 inches) between the bed and two of the walls. Trying to get out of bed to the bathroom was extremely difficult. The bathtub was not full size, so I'm not sure how an adult was supposed to take a bath. If you are a single, the rooms would be fine, but for two or more people, they are VERY cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Safe and Clean----But”
Reviews.Author: Dixonr925
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel only two blocks from Times Square, that is safe, clean and supported by a nice staff then the Econo Lodge on 47th Street might be a possibility. I stayed at this property March 10th and found it acceptable--with one exception; the rooms are claustrophobically small. If traveling alone, with minimal luggage you will get by, but I would not recommend this property for couples or persons staying longer than a few nights. If you needed to use the phone you had to crawl across the bed as the space between the foot of the bed and the wall was approximately 6 inches. Rooms do not have their own climate control, and mine was incredibly hot so you get what you get without anyway to adjust the temperature. I like some space in a hotel room, not a lot, but at least enough so two people aren't bumping into each other. I'll end by saying again--this property was clean, safe and a reasonably good value, however, because the rooms are incredibly small I would not stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice being so close to times square. It was reasonably priced and clean. The breakfast was a little undesirable. The elevator was old and not safe. The front desk staff was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “The best for the value.”
Reviews.Author: DBP_RS_BRazil
Reviews.Content: he hotel is very well located, for that price I could only find two other options: the Big Apple hostel, which is closed and even the private rooms have shared bathrooms, and the New York inn, which seemed horrible from outside even though it's next to this hotel. The elevator is really slow and the pillows were too soft, I had trouble sleeping with them. The wifi was very, slow almost unusable, it wasn't possible to make a Skype call. The room is very small and a bit noisy, but it wasn't a problem for me. That is because there is a fire department warehouse one block from it in the eighth avenue. The breakfast is great, I didn't expected that. Just in front of the hotel is a Duane Reade which is pharmacy that is open 24/7. I would definitely book this hotel again, there is no better cost/benefit relationship.

Reviews.Title: “bthompson@macconnect.com”
Reviews.Author: BigfootMN
Reviews.Content: The Econo Lodge Times Square is a good option for those that are looking for basic lodging in an expensive city. It is well located relative to the subway system and only a block from Times Square. The room (queen bed) was not nearly as small as some we have experienced and even had a desk and chair. The room was clean and the bathroom appeared to have been recently updated. Breakfast was minimal, with little room to sit. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We had one minor problem with the TV and it was taken care of quickly. All in all, convenient, good value, with minimal extras. There was a bit of street noise, as the pub across the street closed about 3 AM.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Vila Real de Santo Antonio, Portugal
Reviews.Title: “Times Square... on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: MartaFerrer
Reviews.Content: Econo Lodge, a simple but cosy hotel, was our best (and cheapest) option to feel and live Times Square! No, you won't be treated exclusively, but, for its price, you'll feel like a VIP in an easy ambiance with friendly and helpfull staff! We'll be back: that's for sure! Ourtravelingwithoutmoving.wordpress.com

Reviews.Title: “Excelent for a Budget and Safeness in New York.”
Reviews.Author: DKRJ18
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great as you are right at the center of Times Square, Manhattan. When you make your first step from hotel to outside you find 47st and 8t Av. The hotel staff (specially Trinita) was as good as the location. They were very helpful. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME LOCATION.. GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Blitzistanbul
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great as you are right at the center of Manhattan when you make your first step from hotel to outside. However hotel staff was not as good as the location. As they were just average not very helpful i can't praise them..Rooms are quite tiny but clean . I would surely reccomend this place for the travellers who are looking for a budget and central place to stay in NY City..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Gus K
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a great location. The rooms are TINY, but extremely clean. The location was about 2 blocks from Times Square, right in the heart of the theater district. If you want to be right in the middle of things, and are planning on seeing a show, this hotel is perfect. You're in New York - do you plan on spending a bunch of time in your room? So the size should not matter. Free wi-fi in the room was great, because the computer downstairs charges out of the wazoo to use. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for Location”
Reviews.Author: MrsSnowman
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is great and for the price it's really not too bad. The rooms are pretty clean, but they are very small (it is New York though). We didn't spend much time in the room at all so that didn't matter too much. The room was pretty warm, so it was a little uncomfortable at night. You can call the front desk and they will come open your window but being that it was 30 degrees outside, I dealt with the heat. Overall, it's a nice hotel and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Small but enough”
Reviews.Author: kellaussie
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but perfect for one person or a couple who doesn't plan on spending much time in their room. The staff are helpful, although the cleaners sometimes didn't come until 6pm at night. The free internet access was great and fast! The breakfast was bagels, coffee and yoghurt but enough to get you going for a big day of sightseeing. Such a great location 2mins walk from the heart of Times Square and 5mins walk from the subway!

Reviews.Title: “NYC”
Reviews.Author: SkiBabeWiddrington
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at beginning of December 2011. The room was basic but adequate, as not a lot of time was spent in it. The location was superb and the staff on the front desk were very helpful. For a cheap short break in New York it was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Econo Lodge”
Reviews.Author: janetbanfield
Reviews.Content: A real find in midtown New York. On top of Times Square and Broadway. Staff were so helpful and effecient.Rooms small but clean.A bit noisy cos the City never sleeps they say. Breakfast not fantastic.could do with a few more tables and chairs in lobby.Very good price for an excellent location.would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: lidge38
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at this hotel. We were attending a wedding and did not plan to spend much time in the hotel. The room was more than adequate, although postage stamp size. The amenities were very adequate with a hair dryer, in room safe, iron and ironing board, decent size closet housed in a armoire. The bed was queen size and very comfortable. Continental breakfast was ample with scones, mini danish, bagels and cream cheese, cereal, milk, coffee, tea, orange juice, oranges and bananas. The only down side of our visit was that our room was on the 2nd floor in the front of the hotel. The street noise was very loud and we could hear the people on the street having a joyous time along with the clip clop of the horse drawn carriages. This hotel was very reasonably priced as compared to others in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Theatre District Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gouverneur
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Econolodge Times Square is its location in the theatre district. Given its location, the price was reasonable. The room was clean but tiny. The staff was pleasant and competent. Econolodge serves a continental breakfast but could use a few more tables to eat at. Noise from traffic did penetrate the room. The hotel was a sellout when I was there so book early. Arthur A.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Small, but clean”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: Third stay there. A block from Times Sq. Lots of carry outs near by. Rooms very small. Bathroom small too, but well done. Breakfast basic with ceral and rolls. Coffee all day. Will stay there again because it's a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: kathy w
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent place to stay. Super close to everything, walking distance. Clean. Yes small, but everything in New York is. The front desk staff was very helpful and very friendly every time that we came or went from the hotel. For the money, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pass This One By”
Reviews.Author: ScienceTchr
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good: location is 2 blocks from Times Square, the front desk staff was polite and helpful. Unfortunately, the bad was really bad. The entire hotel was shabby. The carpets were worn and frayed. Walls were scarred. The non-smoking room smelled strongly of stale cigarette smoke; probably years of it imbedded into the wall paper, carpet, and curtains. We had just returned from a cruise and the room was smaller and more cramped than our cabin on the ship. The window air conditioner was very noisy. If we had been staying more than one night, we definitely would have looked for other accomodations. My advise: pass this one by; don't be hooked in by the lower price and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: colmirl
Reviews.Content: From it's location, is pretty obvious that this will probably the most expensive Econo Lodge you'll ever stay in! It's slap bang in the theatre District of NYC, so it's pretty conveniently located for all of mid-town and with good transit links elsewhere (subways, buses etc). The rooms were small, and so-so furnished (2 small pillows per double bed, very thin linens, scratchy towels) but functional. I thought the toiletries were awful,and smelt of urinal cakes. In fact they were really unpleasant - I've never used lotion that left my skin stinging! Free internet and phone calls were a nice touch. The basic breakfast in the morning was ok, but you often had no where to eat it due to a lack of space. It could also do with being available later on the weekends - 6am to 9am is a little early on Saturday/Sunday. Staff were generally friendly, and apart from the one that checked me in, who appeared to want to be anywhere but there, they all seemed happy to help. Street noise (which seeps in via the air conditioner) is an issue, so invest in some good ear plugs! Would I return? No, probably not. It's too expensive for what's on offer. I'd rather pay a little more and get more bang for my buck.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, small and clean”
Reviews.Author: djpepe
Reviews.Content: This is by far the most I have paid and the smallest room I have ever stayed in! However for the location I understand it is normal. It was only me in the room (which was a good thing) I had to crawl across the bed to answer the phone. And I must say I did not know that bath tubs came in half lengths!! But there were no bed bugs and it was nice and clean. The staff were always friendly and the coffee always on. They do include a small breakfast but there is no room to eat it. Be patient if you want the elevator, it's painfully slow. This hotel has free (yes free) Canada and USA calling- neat! and of course wifi but only in the lobby. The location is great and I would stay again (If I can afford it!!) I don't know if they had bigger rooms, but two plus people would be tight.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: exNZ
Reviews.Content: Good location in the centre of the theatre district of NYC. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and although small were comfortable. However the road noise was a drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: atruetexan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located just a couple of blocks from Times Square. The room was clean howbeit small. We were on the 6th floor and read these are larger than lower floors so I think we were blessed. I have pictures that I will post later. A couple of drawbacks - breakfast was very continental, nothing hot except for the oatmeal and bitter coffee. Being on the 6th floor, room service came after we got back to our room, so we told them to give us towels. I don't know how they would have cleaned such a small room with all our luggage sitting around. We were there for 3 nights so sleeping on the same sheets were okay. There was only room for one to walk at the end of the bed. Being across from fire station, there was some noise, but we wore ear plugs. The staff was very helpful. Fast check in and check out - they even said they would hold our luggage if need be. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Clean and Modern but very tiny!”
Reviews.Author: perth_couple2555555
Reviews.Content: After our first 4 days we stayed in Mid Town, then we moved to this hotel, only 5 blocks from times square! It was fantastic location. Great service, the staff were very friendly everytime we came or went we got a smile and a hello or a have a good day. Check in was smooth. Our room was pretty modern but extremely small but as most are in NYC. We were on the 3rd floor and i think a little to close to the ground as at night it was very noisy, perhaps higher up would be less noisy? the small room and the noise at night were the only down falls. the room was clean, the bed (only a large double as id say thats all that fits in their rooms) was very comfortable. the bathroom also tiny but modern and great water pressure. i would stay here again, for sure but i think there is defintiely bigger hotels for the same price (around $200 US per night) but for the location, friendliness and cleanliness it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “ThatÂ´s fine.”
Reviews.Author: VivianeEduardo
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, the staff really friendly and helpful, the room very clean, and one of the few in New York that offers breakfast and free wi-fi in the rooms. Otherwise the room is tiny, more than two suitcases is impossible to circulate through the room. Breakfast is served in the lobby and there are no tables to sit. It is best to take it to the room. The air conditioning is too noisy. But for those who need the room only to sleep, that's fine. After all, you're in NY!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a week in NYC”
Reviews.Author: fabiogmonteiro
Reviews.Content: The only negative aspect is the tiny room. Perfect location, Clean, breakfast included, reasonable price and good staff. Perfect for a single or a couple without kids. Walking distance from all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “We were disappointed and will not stay in another Econo Lodge”
Reviews.Author: carmen c
Reviews.Content: I believe if you pay a little bit more for a hotel you will get "better bang for your buck." I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my husband, although the location was awesome the room on the other hand, could have been better. As previously mentioned in the reviews the room is very tiny and cramped. I would not recommend this hotel if you are travelling with a family, the room is ok for 2 people at most. There is little space to walk in the room, I would have to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom or door. Breakfast was non-existent it was just a shelf of juice, coffee, possibly toast, not much to choose from. The hotel room could use some updating: - The bathroom: Although the sink looked updated, the showerhead/tub could use some renos and spots of rust were noticed. The shower curtains had stains and looked "old". The overall space in the bathroom was small, the toilet was right near the door, so you had to "squeeze in" before closing the door. - The carpet floor was just average and dirty. - The room : Air condition was the one where you put on the window sill, I noticed stains on the walls and cracks. - The hallway is narrow and quite humid cause the aircondition does not flow though the whole hallway. - One day the cleaing staff failed to clean our room, and when asked, reminded us that they could not clean it since they were leaving at 5 o'clock. Even though we had been out of the room most of the day and it was still not cleaned. - Be careful with your valuables because our camera came up missing and the last time we saw it was in the room. When we discovered the camera was missing we had to call the hotel several times before getting a response that they didn't find the camera. I would ONLY recommend this hotel, just for the location. It is walking distance to most things and does not take long to get to your destination, but if you are looking for comfort, this would not be the hotel to book at. For me, I would have spent a little bit extra to be comfortable and have space to put my luggage. I guess it was just a place to sleep, but the bed wasn't that comfortable either.

Reviews.Title: “VERY small but clean”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel3939
Reviews.Content: The rooms are extremely small! Now yes, if you've ever stayed in NYC you know ALL of the hotels generally have much smaller rooms, but this hotel is even smaller than average. However, this hotel is one of the cleanest hotels I've stayed in. They take pride in being a small hotel that provides its guests with the utmost in cleanliness. Overall its an excellent location close to a lot of theaters and restaurants. If you don't mind a small space definitely book it. Also- absolutely NO signs of bed bugs which is a huge plus in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Clean - Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: scimplicity
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the price and location of this place. It is up from Time Square enough to be quieter but still in easy walking distance to everything you want to see. Gray Line tours is right next door and stops are right on the corner for their hop on hop off service. The rooms are small but very clean and have everything you need. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Only bad part is elevator is slow and one day was broken.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: TazRon
Reviews.Content: We decided to celebrate my birthday by going to the "Big City" and taking in the "sights and sounds". When we arrived at the hotel we were pleasantly surprise to be greeted by two very friendly and knowledgeable front desk individuals. They were up-beat and were able to check us in early because my transportation got us to the city earlier than expected. The room, although a bit small, was exceptionally clean and had everything the description indicated. In fact, the whole hotel is very clean and quiet except for the occasional sirens from the "outside" world .... but remember, this is the city of the world....you must expect activity outside. The next day, you are treated to a free continental breakfast which isn't the greatest but does offer bagels, yogurt, coffee, juice, and cereal, You are better off going a few steps away and have a "real" breakfast but it will cost you. They also held our luggage because our transportation wouldn't be ready until 8:00pm. This is a great service so you can get an extra day in the city and not worry about dragging your luggage with you. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: Laurenantics
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for 4th of July weekend and I was catching a show on Broadway and going to the Harry Potter Exhibition at Discovery Times Square. This hotel was a 2/10 of a mile walk from both. Obviously - the location of this place is top notch. It's exactly where I wanted and needed to be since I was traveling alone. The hotel is perfectly fine. Nothing special. The rooms are exactly the size you'd expect for NYC. I only had one problem. I called down for an extra pillow and was delivered one with long black curly hairs all over it. As if it was just taken off a used bed and handed to me. I called down and told them and there was no apology - just a promise for a clean pillow. I would still stay here again. I got the clean pillow. All was well.

Reviews.Title: “This was a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: windmill379
Reviews.Content: The Econo Lodge Times Square, 302 W. 47th, New York, is located next to attractions, restaurants, theaters, and subway stations. Our room was exceptionally clean and smelled good. The continential breakfast featured quality items like yogurt, pastries, hard cooked eggs, and bagels. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Samurai_Dog
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of it's location and we're really pleased that it was so close to Times Square, Broadway theaters, and my husband's work conference. POSITIVES **Location! Only a 5 min. walk to Times Square and an easy walk to all the Broadway theaters. **Cleanliness - Our room was very clean. We did the usual bedbug test, especially since it's New York. We also checked the bedbug registry and they have no reports so far. **Continental breakfast - Not a huge selection, but they had bagels, coffee, pastries, cereal, etc. **Shower pressure - I hate when I go to a hotel and the water trickles out of the shower head. Great pressure here. NEGATIVES **We could not adjust the heat and it was quite warm in our room and really hot in the hallways. **Noise - We could hear street conversations, honking, and outside noise all night. There are window air conditioning units in the windows and the sound just goes right through the vents. **Room size. Our room was TINY. Only one of us could walk to the bed at a time. The other person had to duck in the bathroom. It was hard to find a place for both of our suitcases. My husband left his by the door to the room. We did see inside another room while it was being cleaned and it was larger and the furniture layout was better than ours. **There was some problem with their key card reader and they could not re-set our key so we had to wait for someone to walk us to our room and let us in. Minor issue and it was fixed later in the day. **Our tv reception would come and go. It was perfect the first day and fuzzy after that. I checked to make sure the cables were secure and they were. We were not in our room much since there is so much to do in NY so it was perfect for us. If you are planning on staying in your room a lot, I would not recommend it unless you are alone. It is cramped and hot. For sleeping purposes, it was fine. I was so tired from exploring NY all day that I could tune out the street noise and get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Miserably HOT!”
Reviews.Author: dlsalbuquerque
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not bad overall. The location is good, it was pretty clean, and the staff was friendly enough. The huge problem was the heating system. There are no thermostats in the rooms, and no way to control the temperature. I asked the woman at the front desk, and was told It is "centralized". Despite being around 30 degrees outside, the rooms were around 85 degrees...it was miserable and impossible to sleep, and impossible to adjust the temperature as the A/C was off. Stay somewhere else unless you like sleeping in an oven.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap and convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Michael255093
Reviews.Content: This is the third time Iâ€™ve stayed at the EconoLodge Times Square. The location is fantastic. Less than five minutes walk to Times Square. Numerous Subway lines are also within easy walking distance. There is a drug store on the other side of 47th street which provides all kinds of groceries, an ATM, pharmacy services, etc. There area also a few great take out joints nearby on 8th Avenue. There arenâ€™t too many frills on offer at the EconoLodge. Breakfast is provided and consists of cereals, bagels, some fruit, coffee and OJ. There is only one elevator and itâ€™s quite slow. If, for some reason, youâ€™re looking for a room to do some aerobics, you may be disappointed because youâ€™re going to struggle finding enough space to set up the ironing board, let alone do much else other than stow your luggage and lie down. 8th Avenue is a popular route for fire fighters, so you may find yourself disturbed at 3 AM by the sound of a fire engine. There isn't much insulation from the noise of the city that never sleeps (but if you're looking for some place quiet, why are you visiting NYC?). Having said that, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The place is clean. Who wants to spend time in their hotel room when theyâ€™re in New York City, anyway?! The EconoLodge provides a good place to lay your weary head. Iâ€™ve compared prices a few times and Iâ€™ve never been able to beat the price on offer for a comparable hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for short night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Suzywuzy22
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel on Monday 29th November 2010 with my friend, where we were booked in for five nights. The lady at the reception was very friendly and quickly booked us in to our room on the top floor looking out on to 47th Street. The room I found was extremely small, yet adequate for what we needed realistically. We just about had enough room to throw our suitcases in two corners, but for two people that were planning on being up early every morning, room space wasn't really a priority. We had expected it, especially at the competitive price we got the room for. The room was clean and tidy as was the bathroom however small it was too (I also found that after we'd showered the room got very warm, mainly from the steam in the bathroom), but again adequate. If you want a cheap room, expect a room along this lines. The big plus for me was the fact that the hotel was only literally a 2 minutes walk from Times Square. I did find that at night the location in general was very very noisy (horns blowing, trucks moving around, etc) but as it was only a block or two from Times Square, that was also to be expected, and as far as I'm aware all the rooms face the one way. There was breakfast served in the lobby every morning (coffee, orange juice, small selection of teas, croissants, bagels, etc - ps the orange juice was delicious!!!) but my problem with this was that it seemed to be cleared away shortly after 9am. I don't think it would have hurt to leave it out a little longer. Check out was quick and efficient too with the same girl that checked us in. She kindly took our luggage into the office as we still had time after check out to wander around, and booked us a taxi to the airport. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a place to lie down for about 6 hours sleep, nothing fancy but a nice clean room where you can get a few hours rest to get up early again and get out for the day. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “cheep and mediocre”
Reviews.Author: edukater214
Reviews.Content: The location of Econo Lodge is great; there's no denying that. But if you're looking for a nice hotel, this is not it. It was clean and safe, but the positives stop there. The bed was very hard. The water did not work well in the shower. We stayed in the "penthouse suite" on the seventh floor. It was hardly bigger than the average dorm room, and the elevator stopped at the sixth floor. If you're looking for a place to crash at night after you're out sightseeing or show-going during the day, this place if perfect. But if you're looking for a romantic or plush evening, upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hasbunangel
Reviews.Content: Staff is not customer oriented. The room is tiny, dirty and smelly. You can hear when people talk in the other room. Breakfast is poor and elevator is ancient. Too expensive for what you get. Are we just paying for location? Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: prettyoneazle
Reviews.Content: Arrived from cruise ship and was given a room by mid morning. This was a great surprise and was greatly appreciated. The room was very small, but was quite clean. My only complaint was the noise from the Irish Pub across the street at 3am. Also, the continental breakfast ends too early. Great location!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: Shark_Girl_Anna
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in NY at 9:00 we checked our bags at the counter and told them we'd be back at 3:00 for check-in time. When we got back, we were told that we had been bumped. We had booked the hotel 4 months in advance and booked all theater tickets and dinner reservations based on this hotel location. They moved us 10 blocks south to another hotel that was shabby, unclean and out of the way (the Pennsylvania). By the time we got all the way down to the other hotel and waited in another line to check in, we missed our reservations for that night. The Econo Lodge staff was unhelpful, unapologetic, and uncaring. Had we been told at 9:00am that we were bumped, we could have made arrangements to find a better location and made our dinner and theatre reservations, Don't let them do it to you.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk lied to me”
Reviews.Author: Trustmeiamnice
Reviews.Content: They own me money but never put it on my credit card. If you want to do whats right feel free tto give me my money econo lodge. the manager is the same as when i stayed there in 2008. Thet told me me they were lower the price of the room but never can up with the money. the head office offered me 100 buck to shut me up but i will never ever stay at an econo lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: travelling_cdn_girl
Reviews.Content: I believe if you pay a little bit more for a hotel you will get "better bang for your buck." I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with a girlfriend, although the location was awesome the room on the other hand, could have been better. As previously mentioned in the reviews the room is very tiny and cramped. I would not recommend this hotel if you are travelling with a family, the room is ideal for 2 people at most. There is little space to walk in the room, I would have to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom or door. One thing about this hotel is you would have to "recharge" your hotel room key every day before leaving. I tried getting back into the room late at night and my "key" would not work. When I went to the desk they said you have to recharge it every day when you leave and its could for that day only. I guess for security reasons that was good but annoying cause before going back to the room you have to "recharge it". Breakfast was non-existent it was just a shelf of juice, coffee, possibly toast, not much to choose from. And the Wi-fi would not load even with their password and login ID, just plain slow. If, you wanted to use the common area for the internet you would have to pay for usage and printer usage. The hotel room could use some updating: - The bathroom: Although the sink looked updated, the showerhead/tub could use some renos and spots of rust were noticed. The shower curtains had stains and looked "old". The overall space in the bathroom was small, the toilet was right near the door, so you had to "squeeze in" before closing the door. - The carpet floor was just average and dirty. - The room : Air condition was the one where you put on the window sill, I noticed stains on the walls and cracks. - The hallway is narrow and quite humid cause the aircondition does not flow though the whole hallway. I would ONLY recommend this hotel, just for the location. It is walking distance to most things and does not take long to get to your destination, but if you are looking for comfort, this would not be the hotel to book at. For me, I would have spent a little bit extra to be comfortable and have space to put my luggage. I guess it was just a place to sleep, but the bed wasn't that comfortable either. Still had a great time in NY! Sorry to those reading this long review, hope this was helpful and you enjoy your trip to the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “They put the 'econo' in Econolodge”
Reviews.Author: geminij3
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Times Square and so many other things. Tried to find a "deal" nearby, for 3 nights. The room was small, which I am used to in NYC, but it was unclean and smelled moldy. They offered breakfast, which was minimal but of course, better than nothing. The staff was not very friendly, and had more social time than business time.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel - Very Poor service - Only stay here if you are desperate”
Reviews.Author: COOL_GUEST
Reviews.Content: There was only ONE good thing about the hotel; the location. Everything else was very poor. The rooms are TINY and I mean TINY. The smallest rooms I have ever stayed in. Really basic - not even a tea or coffee maker in the room. Bathroom was also very small. The customer service was terrible. I made a call to reception and it took them 2 hours to respond to my simple request. The TV reception was extremely bad. Also be warned - they charge $3 PER ITEM to store your luggage - and they do not waive this under any circumstances. So if you arrive before 3pm - they will charge to store your bags. The same again on the day you leave. They do not do early check-ins. I was unable to speak to the manager - even though the manager was there - they pretended she wasn't. The customer service is rated 0/10. The worst customer service ever. They really don't care to make your stay pleasurable and if you are unhappy - they don't care in the slightest. Two ladies who checked in before us said they would never stay there again because of the $3 per bag charge (they had 4 bags). The hotel staff offered no discount on the $12 bag storage charge in order to make the customer happy. ICE is only at reception. The lift is VERY SLOW and only ONE lift in the building. If you are unhappy for any reason - do not expect the staff to take any action. I think they get bonuses for giving guests the worst customer service - otherwise I cannot understand how they can run a hotel this way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Ho Hum Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ojdidit
Reviews.Content: The only reasons to stay here are the location and the price. Just a few minutes walk to Times Square. The room is actually the smallest I have ever been in and I am a traveler of age 65. But if you want just a bed, a rather ratty look room and lobby and a breakfast of semi stale food then stay. We paid $150 a night plus another 20% in taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AshtonNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Yes the rooms are small but they are perfect for one or two persons. Hotel was quiet (even with some traffic noise from the outside --- but I enjoyed hearing it), the staff was excellent, the room was very clean and the bath was perfect. After staying at the YMCA for years and years and seeing it get less and less nice, this place was a perfect alternative. I would stay at Econo Lodge Times Square in a minute. I really enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but clean, modern and safe”
Reviews.Author: rachandfil
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for clean, reasonably priced accommodation in NYC, this is it. The location was really good (5 mins walk from times square) and the rooms although TINY were really clean and modern. Bad points are that you cannot control the heating temperatures in your room as they are centrally controlled, the free wifi is pretty bad but there are lots of neighbours to sponge off! Also, it's across the road from a fire station, so your sleep will be disturbed until you get used to the loudness of the city! Good points, very clean, modern, good free breakfast in the morning and free tea and coffee 24/7 Feels pretty safe and secure too.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!! GENERAL MANAGER NON RESPONSIVE!!!”
Reviews.Author: opticalstorm
Reviews.Content: You do not get what you book. The air condition did not work. It would not turn down below 76 degrees. A remote was supplied to us after they could not find out why the controls would not work. The hair dryer broke. When we called the front desk one was at our door in about 15 minents. The only problem is that it was wall mounted and I had to uninstall the old one and install the new one. The breakfest is a joke. Every night around midnight a gallone of milk was put out on the counter. That same gallon of mile stayed out each night (WE STAYED 5 NIGHTS) untill 6 in the moring when they poured it into another container. The staff is very rude. Do not try to save a few bucks by staying here. You will be disapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Big Mistake”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler1006
Reviews.Content: It's so hard to think of anything that was positive about this experience. We were charged upon check in even though the room was prepaid, so had to spend a lot of time correcting the error. There was no hot water for shower. Room really small and tight. Across street from fire and EMT station. Constant noise from emergency vehicles all night. Elevator was very slow. Breakfast that they use as a selling feature served on a counter in the check in area (very very small) where you sit on the ledge in the front window and hold food in your lap. People actually came in off the street to grab food. Neighborhood very shakey. Businesses and people we would not normally associate with. Oh, yes, and the bed was bottom of the line and very uncomfortable. Might have saved $20 but definitely not worth it. Good feature was that it was very close to Broadway shows.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further, this is the place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jamnv
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many places in NYC and this is a nice find. After reading reviews for many hours I picked Econo Lodge. The location is great, the rooms are clean and the price couldn't be beat. I usually travel with friends or children and look for safety, cleanliness, comfy bed and decent location. Sure the room/bathroom is small, but how much are you really in the room and I have seen just as small of rooms in NYC for a lot more money. We sleep in it and get ready in it, so it was just what we were looking for. I have stayed in four star hotels in NYC, but wouldn't hesitate to stay in this two star again. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. We only took advantage of the breakfast once, it was small (grab and go), but a nice jump start to the day, and besides there aren't many hotels in NYC that have anything set out for breakfast. I was pleasantly surprised by our entire experience at Econo Lodge. We are big walkers and we walked all over from this location at all hours and felt safe, and I was with my teenage daughter. I don't make a point of nit picking small things at the places I have stayed at, I find the same problems in high or low end hotels; I think it's all in what you are looking for. Thanks for making our trip safe, comfortable and enjoyable:>)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: MacaronniMastroiani
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel!It has a yummy breakfast with croissants, jelly, chocolate, milk and all that good stuff!!The rooms were clean, had a very good bathroom (good conditions) and most of all is really well located.

Reviews.Title: “small,clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: san18
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location for theatres etc. The rooms are extremely small, but very clean. The staff is helpful. Call direct and ask for the Manager's Specials. Breakfast..bagel,cake & coffee free in the lobby until 9:30. For a cheap clean room and a place to sleep in a perfect location for all sights etc. Shops and restaurants all around the block. Walking to all sights.

Reviews.Title: “If you can call it that”
Reviews.Author: scatty3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Econolodge hotel NY if you call it that,we were tired a friendly face would have been nice ,no such luck, the staff at reception were unhelpful and useless.Got our key after about half hour went to the room we were given ,it was a double not a twin so off we go back into the lift i knew it was going to be fun when we got downstairs we explained it wasnt the room we had booked the receptionest said did you book in yesterday ,no half a hour ago through gritted teeth .We ended up paying another $139 .To be fare the young man at reception was very helpful.Starving hungry next day came down for breakfast which takes place in the reception area only one word inedible,the room was cold and very small but clean .The cleaners were brilliant i think they should get the reception job.!

Reviews.Title: “Agreed - clean, good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: MNtravel01
Reviews.Content: We banked on the reviews here and stayed 2 nights while seeing shows in NYC. The review were right. This is somewhat of a hidden gem. The value ($169.99) was very good. The locaiton is fantastic - within 1-2 blocks of most theaters, short walk to Times Square, and 1 "long block" to 9th Avenue where there are tons of restaurants (and more on 8th Avenue too). The room we had was exceptionally small -- really little more than a bed, desk and bathroom. There was literally one foot on one side of the bed and one foot space at the foot of the bed. Other than that, there was very little room to maneuver around. Yet the room was very clean and fresh. The place has clearly been renovated from top to bottom. There is a small chest/wardrobe, and I mean small. It has a safe in it and it's not much wider than the safe. The safe was nice to have but too small for my laptop. There is a small desk which is good but if the chair is used you can't walk past it. The bathroom is clean and small but usable. Essentially it's like being on a cruise ship where there is no a spare square foot around. But since we went sightseeing all day, came back to get changed, went to theater and then late dinner and did not get back until midnight, we basically only used it for the bathroom, changing and sleeping. A good find and good value in an otherwise expensive part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but who sleeeps in New York!!!”
Reviews.Author: SirRogue58
Reviews.Content: I've read reviews on this hotel before I booked but when I stay in a hotel I only use it for sleeping in. So the size of the rooms does not matter. The location was great a few yards from Times Square so close enough but far enough to be away from the bustle. The lift did make a bit of a racket when we 1st arrived but it was soon fixed. The room was very small for example, there was a flat screen TV on the wall and I still had to lean back as I passed between it and the bed. But that's the only complaint I could make if I wanted to. We stayed 3 nights and found the bagels, muffins, fruit & coffee enough for breakfast but at time did have to stand to have it as it was served in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely just a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: silverpurplstar
Reviews.Content: If you were expecting a large room, you are quite mistaken. My girl firend and I went here over a year ago and I still remember the look of the place. The hotel is within a few blocks of time square, but the hotel itself is a bit dated. You receive a continental breakfast in the morning of whatever bagels or muffins they have. They do offer coffee and tea for those who are interested. Not a satisfactory full meal, but good enough to start your day. The hotel room we got was one with a queen bed. With two girls and two full sized luggages, it was a bit cramped. We had to maneuver our luggage so we had access to it. The bed took up most of the room. The bathroom was on the small side as well. The room itself was old. The room had a weird smell without the air conditioner on and you definitely needed air conditioning in August. The hotel did manage to squeeze in a table into the room. This room is great for if you are going with just one other person and you aren't planning to spend too much time in the room. It's definitely nothing fancy, but if you just need a place to stay it's a good price for NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable accommodations for a great price”
Reviews.Author: westseattlered
Reviews.Content: This is an Econo Lodge, not the Four Seasons, but it does have the backing of a national chain. It is located not even 2 blocks from Times Square, on the north end near Central Park. The rooms are small, but from my experience, most rooms are in Midtown Manhattan. But when you're in NYC, you're not spending much time in the room anyway. I've seen the reviews on similarly priced hotels, and if you even get a private bathroom, you may see rodents. But at the Econo Lodge, the rooms were fairly clean and you get your own decent-sized bathroom. I actually stay at this hotel every time I go to NYC, because working for a non-profit, you can't beat the price for a decent hotel in that location. During my last stay, I came back from a day out working and almost cried with joy when I saw how much care the maid service took with my belongings when cleaning the room. It was immaculate and organized. The accommodations are nothing fancy by any means, but you're not going to find a better location with nicer staff for under $150 a night in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: mrboog
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because it was close to Times Square and was about $120 a night. A good price for the area. We were not disappointed. The rooms are small, but they were clean and the location was great!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: bradboston44
Reviews.Content: This place is miserable! It took us two hrs just to get checked in after spending a 6 hr ride to get here. There was some internet issues... We went out for dinner hoping the issues would be resolved by then...they were not! We were not offered anything for our inconvenience, not even a water and just said " there is nothing we can do" even though their motto is " where great customer service doesn't cost extra", but this place has no customer service at all. When we got back the elevator was broken and there was nobody in the lobby for any help at all. So what are you paying for...please spend the extra 200 bucks for a much better place, this place is an insult. The next night we tried to get back into our hotel room and had to go back down to the lobby with the most unfriendly employee ever because nieiher of our keys would let us into our room, it was then that she informed us that you had to get new keys every freaking day! Imagine that. No reason what so ever for another inconvience, not to mention they dont even have vending machines!

Reviews.Title: “Hot water should be a basic in North America... no contractors on the weekend???”
Reviews.Author: Cattamaran
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms to stay at the Econo Lodge over the September long weekend. We were greated by a please lady that was working the front desk and we thought we were off to having a great stay. We could not have been so wrong... The next morning we go to have a shower and we find out there is no hot water... I phoned the front desk and they said the hot water was not working in the entire area. We did not get frustrated as maybe that was the case and that was out of the control of the hotel. We check later on that night and they say the hot water is now working but when we get back to our room we discover that it is not working yet again. We phone down to the front desk to discover they know it is still a problem and don't know when it will be fixed. The next morning we try to have a showever to our disappointment to find out the hot water is not working again which means that we are forced to have cold showers. This was clearly not fun since I have very long hair! When we talked to the front desk there was no manager to express our concerns to and our compensation for a bad stay was 10% off our room. We are in New York.... having hot water is a basic necessity not a luxury item... telling us you could not get someone to come an fix it until Tuesday after the long weekend is just unacceptable! There is one thing to have someone go wrong for a customer during their stay but the moment of truth for your organization is how you resolve the problem... this differentiates whether or not the client will ever come back! Econo Lodge you missed the boat and there were 4 ladies from 4 families in those 2 rooms and we live in difference Cities. Do the math to figuer out how many people we have told about our experience and how many people will NEVER visit your hotel since you did not compensate for this problem in an appropriate mannor! The lost business along from the four of us is much greater than it would have cost you to discount our rooms appropriately!

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: Victorious55
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a couple of friends at the Econo lodge for the labour day weekend and the hotel had no hot water for the weekend. The staff didn't apologize and the toilet in one of the rooms overflowed twice.

Reviews.Title: “Uneccptable disregard”
Reviews.Author: erictsalgado
Reviews.Content: The only good thing at the hotel is it's location. The rooms are tinny - you almost have to choose between you or your luggage - and the staff (exception made for Andrew) is very unfriendly. Even though they say there's free wi-fi connection in the room, I've been staying there for an entire week and couldn't get online!!!!!! And when I look to the front desk so they can get it fixed, they give a shi***** about it!!! NOT RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: mariners09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Econo Lodge for 3 nights whilst visiting New York. Never been to New York before, then this is a good place to stay! The rooms are very small i mean very small BUT it's clean and some where to sleep and freshen up, grab a coffee on your way out in the morning what more do you want for the price? Location is EXCELLENT you walk out the door turn right and just 1 block your on Times Square right in the centre of everything. I would highly recommend the Your buses for seeing New York, it's cheap and a great way to see New York and all it's Famous Land marks. You just hop and off as many times as you like throughout the day. I would stay at Econolodge again and recommend it to anyone if anything for it's Location, the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: l1verpool
Reviews.Content: We satyed in Econo lodge in April 2008. Having been to New york before I was looking forward to taking my children (teenagers) and mother. We has booked 3 rooms and requested a twin for the children. When we arrived there was no twin room and ended up paying an extra $400. The receptionis was rude and unhelpful. The hotel is small the rooms even smaller. There was little room for 2 people and if 1 person was getting ready the other had to stay in hte bathroom or sit on the bed. It was very noisy as you would expect near times square, however there is a Firestation nearby and sirens going all night. The only plus was the free breakfast of mainly bagels and coffee/tea the latter being available all day and night. Would I stay again ? no.

Reviews.Title: “The review were right”
Reviews.Author: debbie1759
Reviews.Content: After reading the review about how small the rooms were, I guess seeing is believing! My husband who is is 6'3 and I were in a room on the 4th floor. The bed was more a double than a queen size that we were expecting. The room is extremely small for two people. Getting out of bed was challenging as there was about a 1' space between the foot of the bed and the wall. It was either walk sideways or roll over my husband to get up, lol. Getting ready for our day was comical as only one person could fit in the bathroom and then to get dress was also a challenge too as there was a desk in the room so there wasn't much space between the desk, bed and the walls. At night we did hear a lot of noise but we had the window air conditioning running all the time so that muted out some of the sounds. The linen and the bathroom have seen better days and we actually had to ask for extra towels as they were down to the last threads. The breakfast was ok for what it was worth. Bagels are always good to start off the day with your coffee. Overall it is definitely your low-budget hotel. The location was excellent as it was close by to Times Square and if you want to the the Hop on Hop Off Bus Tours the pick up is across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very compact rooms but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: digger2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September 2007. The room we stayed in was very small, no room for a wardrobe just a small cupboard. The staff where very good and the room was fairly clean, location is excellent. Because of the excellent location it can be a bit noisy at night, but at the end of the day you're in New York there arent many quiet areas it really is a 24 hour city.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: MassachusettsFlower
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here june 17 checked in at 12:30pm our room was not ready at the time they offered us the penthouse suite(HA HA HA) on the 7th floor the only room on the 7th floor but larger free upgrade no extra charge. First thing I did was pull down the bed to check for bed bugs thank goodness no bugs the sheets were clean and no stains on them flat screen tv,safe in the room also a FREE small breakfast 7-10am it got us going in the morning. There was alot of traffic noise and fire station is around the conner but hey is New York you will here traffic any place you stay in NY near times square. I would stay here again in a NY minute it was CLEAN and close to almost everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: allynator2096
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent NYC traveler, so I know about how big apartments & such in the city are. The EconoLodge is NOT in Times Square, more like 4-5 blocks away, but still a good location. It's not much to look at from the outside, but inside it is well maintained & clean. Now, the rooms are SMALL, but any New Yorker will tell you that if you want space, you pay for it. The room fit one king size bed and a small bathroom, and you had to wait for each other to stay still to get around. But, everything was clean and the room came with shamppos & soaps, etc. There was breakfast the next morning (donuts, coffee, bagels, etc.) If you want a luxury hotel, then you will pay for it, for the price we couldn't have asked for much more. I mean, in NYC, how much time do you really want to spend in the room anyway? This hotel is located fairly close to the subway and there is a nice breakfast/diner place near by for some good cheap eats.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy but nice”
Reviews.Author: tustna
Reviews.Content: Cozy? I mean small, but the amenities were great. Desk folks were knowledgeable. Breakfasts were great. Centrally located. Near subway. Theater right next door. What more could you ask? Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection at 47th and 8th”
Reviews.Author: MikeArcade
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there multiple times for business, it is centrally located for everything I need. I am also planning on staying there for personal trips as well. The best price in Manhattan, very knowledgeable people. 5 minutes to Times Square by foot!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but very clean & great location”
Reviews.Author: liu2577
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a whole week and would stay there again. Yes, it's small, but who cares, you are hardly in as you are too busy checking the wonderful NYC. For us what mattered the most was its cleanliness and location. We walked everywhere till late as it was central and safe. The breakfast was average, but it fed us for the morning, so I can't complain! Many hotels don't provide breakfast. I have recommended this hotel to my friends who will visit NYC in 2010. Great value for money, stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: lyndsayloo
Reviews.Content: Me & my boyfriend have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Econo Lodge..here is my opinion... rooms are REALLY small there was barely enough room for us to put our clothes into the drawers as there were about 3 and even they were small, so i wouldnt reccommend this hotel for a group of people or if your staying for a long period of time and it got quite stuffy in there most of the time but there is a fan thats excellent it lets out alot of air. Very clean, rooms were cleaned everyday and towels changed everyday. Safe is in the wardrobe which is free, we used this all the time. It did suit us it was great value for money it's close by to everything, times square is right around the corner. There is a continental breakfast every morning which is just coffee and donuts/croissants etc..and you can take them back to your room. Staff seemed friendly enough but we never had much contact with them. Overall it's a nice place i just dont think there is enough rom for 2 people or more but great value for money. New York is an amazing place and i think we will definetly be returning, there is so much to do and see! we had an amazing time here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and central location”
Reviews.Author: MIBDK
Reviews.Content: This location, only a few hundred metres away from Times Square is perfect, if you are up for some 24h action. There are lots of good cheap eats just around the corner in Hells Kitchen, specially the Five Napkins Burger on the corner of 45th and 9. ave are worth a visit if you are in for some juicy meat.. The rooms are small, so if you are two persons planning to bring loads of luggage or do massive shopping, rent an ekstra room for the luggage :-). Being one person in the room was just perfect. I have lived in smaller and more expensive rooms in London, so value is great for the money. The room was real clean an tidy. Location are a bit noisy, so if you are a light sleeper bring earplugs! There was an in-room safe, but be aware that Laptops bigger than 13" wonÂ´t fit in! Hotel is perfect for young travellers on a budget or if you are travelling alone. A small continental breakfest and 24h coffee are included in the room rate. There is no restaurant but you can bring the breakfest to your room.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for my needs”
Reviews.Author: MazzerP
Reviews.Content: The clue here is in the title - if you want luxury then you'll have to pay for it! I stayed here for five nights and found it perfect for my needs - close enough to the action to be able to walk around, and clean/comfortable. Both these needs were met. My room was a bit 'wee', and if there had been two of me with cases (and shopping) the size of mine then it might have been a squash. However, if your only luggage is a weekend case then it's fine for two. My first room was spotless, but unfortunately the safe didn't work. I called down to reception, was seen to immediately, then was found another room as the safe had had it. (A blessing perhaps as the wireless connection was very slow on sixth floor - but better on fourth!) As mentioned in previous reviews, the proximity to Times Square is great - as a single white female I felt perfectly safe walking around in the evening after a show or meal. The Grey Line tour buses leave at the end of the street - I really enjoyed the tours I did - and just further up on 8th Ave is the fire station that lost the most firefighters on 9/11 - a sobering reminder of the tragedy to befall this great city. I would certainly stay here again - the staff (when I had cause to need them) were friendly and helpful, and being so central was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: ikuyaso
Reviews.Content: Simply put this hotel is probably the best value for the location. It as clean, there was a safe in the room and although the room was tiny it didn't feel uncomfortable. If you have more than two people I'd suggest paying for a bigger room. Don't be put off by the fact that it's an Econo Lodge, it was well kept and felt fresh. There is a breakfast and the staff are all friendly. And of course there is the location. The only issue i had was checking in. I had to wait and there was no where to leave the luggage since the hotel had no extra room. The elevator was insanely slow as well. The area was clean and true to form, the world is at your feet once you step out of the hotel and into the City. I had a wonderful stay and this is where I'll stay the next time I'm in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value”
Reviews.Author: VancouverGirl77
Reviews.Content: After seeing some scary reviews of other cheap hotels in NY, (including pics of rats, bugs & mold), I was apprehensive about booking a cheap hotel. All we needed was basically somewhere to sleep, so we didn't want to pay for anything fancy or big. But I did NOT want a dirty, run-down, rodent infested place either! This place was perfect for what we wanted. It was definitely small and simple, but it was CLEAN and well maintained (it doesn't seem to be an old building, or at least it's been redone inside). The best parts: -great location, just around the corner from Times Square (1block west & a couple blocks north of it) -free wireless -room safe (set your own password) -clean bathroom, hot water, fresh soft towels, hair dryer -comfy bed, clean sheets -air conditioner -flat screen TV (some channels were fuzzy, but you don't come to NY to watch TV!) -free daily newspaper (during the week) -free coffee/tea all day in lobby -free 'breakfast' til 10am in lobby (fruit, cereal, tasty pastries, oatmeal, bagels) -free local calls -smoke-free hotel -price (paid $160+$30 tax CAN/night) Like most NY hotels it seems, the rooms are small and it can get noisy outside (you are downtown near TS after all!). But it wasn't that bad. After walking around all day we were tired enough to sleep through any noise. They'll hold your bags for $3 each after check-out (which is noon). Also, check in is 3pm, but we got there in the morning and got our room right away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: louiesowner
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews about this hotel and it is the main reason I booked it. I wanted something close to Times Square and something that was somewhat affordable. We were warned about the small rooms... and everyone was right... wow... they are small. My hubbie and I managed though. We got in each others way a lot, but it was a clean hotel and perfect ammenities. We landed up reorganizing the furniture a bit so that we could get around a little better. The bathroom was a good size and the bed was comfortable and clean. We had free internet in the room and we used it a lot. We were also informed that they had free long distance phone calls. That came in very handy. I have never been to a hotel that had free long distance phone calls. The continental breakfast was also good. They had coffee all the time in the lobby. The people at the check in counter were always pleasant and friendly. I would definetly recommend this hotel and will probably use it again. We also got a 60 plus rate (my parents) which wasn't advertised.

Reviews.Title: “NO 1 Hotel for Location, Staff and Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: floridadreamScotland
Reviews.Content: I viewed all the reviews on this hotel before I booked. I stayed from 6th nov - 10th Nov. Yes the rooms are very small but also very clean. The shower pressure was great after spending hours walking around the city.The staff were always very helpful and pleasant. The hotel is only 1 block away from Times Square and just around the corner from where the NY Sightseeing bus tours leave from. There is also a 24 hr cafe just round the corner which serves great food. If I am lucky enough to go back to this fantastic city I will be using the Econo Lodge Hotel again. NY CITY Fan from Scotland UK

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: smhasert
Reviews.Content: WHile most NY hotel rooms are small (and this is no exception), the hotel was immaculately clean, location was first rate and the staff was friendly and helpful. I will have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Beenthere73
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close to Times Square and the Theater district. This Econ Lodge was perfect. The room was small - about 2 feet around a queen bed, a small desk & chair, a small wardrobe, tv, ironing board, and a bathroom. Free continental breakfast. Coffee was available all day. The hotel had been renovated in 2006, so it was clean and well-kept. The elevator was quick (unlike some previous reviews had stated) and the hotel was only about 5 floors high, so I'm not sure what the big deal was. I watched the rates and booked one night in advance to get a rate under $200 including taxes. You can leave your luggage in a secured room for $3/day after you check out. Less than 10 minute walk from the Port Authority.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: llhayes
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 nights here and were very pleased. Our room was clean and everything in it appeared to be new. We were on the top floor, so the street noise wasn't too bad, especially with the fan or air conditioner on. We didn't have any trouble with noise coming from inside the motel. We never heard our neighbors talking or their TV. There was also no problem with the slamming of doors in the hallway that is often a problem. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast consisted of wonderful bagels, crossiants, 2 kinds of pastry, 2 kinds of cold cereal, oatmeal, fruit, coffee, tea, and juice. It was important to us to have a room with it's own bathroom, not shared. This motel had the best rate of any I looked at in Manhattan. The room was small, but adequate for two people. We had four bags total and there was a space for everything. I was pleasantly surprised with how nice it was, considering our rate was $179 per night. You won't find a better location. Especially nice was the fact that if you go to 9th and 10th avenues, there are all kinds of restaurants, bakeries, delis and diners, in all price ranges. If you get tired of the free breakfast, give the Galaxy Diner on 9th avenue a try, they have a great breakfast. I highly recommend the Econo Lodge Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Truly NY experience”
Reviews.Author: RBvan
Reviews.Content: Do you like staff being unbelievably rude 3 times out of five? Do you want your sheets to get changed every day? Do you like shabby ceilings and a falling off shower head? Do you prefer having your breakfast standing in the lobby? Do you like sharing your bed with BED BUGS? Do you appreciate staying in a hotel next to Times Sq. and pay $300/night? Then this place is for you

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off..”
Reviews.Author: Wasey
Reviews.Content: This place a rip off compared to the money they charge. Rooms are tiny, Lift works at snail pace, Staff is highly unfriendly, reception and lobby is dirty, i can go on and on... Bottom line is that you can find a much better Lodge or a Hotel at Time square at the same price. I will never stay at this place ever again..

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Marci_Canada
Reviews.Content: The Only good thing about this hotel was the location. The rooms are incredibly small- so small in fact that the TV has to be mounted to the corner of a wall as there is no room for a tv stand. All that is in the room is a bed and a small cupboard for your clothes (couldn't fit much in it). When we arrived our door was open (sketchy) there was blood on the sheets and our phone cord had been cut out of the wall (these all should have been signs to LEAVE). The bathroom was disgusting. There was no vanity to put your toiletries so they all had to go on the floor- which was not clean and had a dirty towel on the floor. Breakfast was- donuts. I think there may have also been cereal and some fruit. The walls are VERY thin- we heard everything that was going on both inside and outside the hotel. When i travel- i want my hotel to be some place to come and unwind at the end of the day and this hotel did not provide that. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can a hotel room BE any smaller?”
Reviews.Author: editorincharge
Reviews.Content: OK, OK, I knew what I was getting into: Earlier reviewers did mention the room was extremely small. But you can't really appreciate just how small it is until you've tried to squeeze between the edge of the bed and the wall and make your way to the other side of a room no bigger than a closet. Actually, it's pretty hilarious -- almost as funny as the water that leaked on our heads from the bathroom ceiling. To the hotel's credit, they switched our room immediately. It was just as small. On the plus side: the location is excellent, smack in the middle of the theater district. You get a real feel for New York as fire trucks, police cars and ambulances race past your window, sirens blaring. The hotel and room are very clean, the bed is comfortable, the front desk people smile and there's a complimentary continental breakfast -- although the bagels run out very quickly and the coffee is undrinkable. So, if you're not claustrophobic and want to save more than a few bucks, the Econo Lodge is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “HATED THIS PLACE!! AWFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Flounder18
Reviews.Content: So, my friends and I showed up, and I handed the lady my confirmation information, and, with the little English she could actually speak, said, "Sorry, we don't have your reservation, and we're all booked tonight." They would NOT honor my reservation there!! I bitched and complained for TWO hours, then finally, they put me in another, NICER hotel, which was actually better. Then I bitched and moaned to get the room comped, when Econo Lodge should have just said "Don't worry, we'll take care of it." New York City is my favorite place in the world, and of the 8 million times I've been there, this was the WORST experience ever. Some people just don't have customer service skills. My advice, try the St. James Hotel on 45th & 6th. You'll enjoy it much much better. (and there are some SWEET ASS Irish Pubs right next door!)

Reviews.Title: “Super clean and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KK814
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my 2 night stay in NYC.Originally my husband was supposed to go but due to unexpected repair bill,he had to stay behind.At first,I was hesitant to stay in the city alone.I did have an event to attend so I went. I got to the hotel early (11:30)expecting to just store my bags till check in time.Imagine my surprise, when the front desk clerk called housekeeping and told them to clean my room next! I was all checked in and in my room by noon. The room was small(of course, its NY!),but very clean.Every single staff member I ran into was very pleasant. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom was squeaky clean. The location is ideal and close to most attractions and restaurants one wants to go to.Subways stops are also very close. Breakfast was super....fresh NY bagels,oatmeal,cereal,juices,pastries........all day long was coffee, tea and fresth fruit(apples and bananas). I felt very safe in this area and at the hotel. I look forward to returning someday soon. Thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep in the city that never sleeps!”
Reviews.Author: HenRon
Reviews.Content: I believe in Tripadvisor and almost without exception use it to plan any of my vacations abroad. So when the hotel we used on our previous vacation to NYC closed, we obviously turned to Tripadvisor to select a new place to stay. All the positive things said about this hotel are true - the water pressure and hot water are just fine and for the noise complaints - I can recommend a great place in Alaska (this is NYC after all). But let's start at the beginning. We arrived early at the hotel after a 23 hour flight (yeah no kidding) and could obviously not check in but they offered to keep our luggage at no cost. After roaming the streets in our "not so fresh" state we got our room just after 12:30. Now use your imagination and imagine the smallest a room can be in a hotel. Take half of that and you have the Econo Lodge! These rooms are TINY but they are clean and the bed is comfortable. What more do you need really? So unless you are a little bigger than the average size this hotel is more than adequate to have a good night's sleep and a place to clean up. You will not spend your days in the hotel with the streets of New York calling outside. The breakfasts consisted of a few pastries, bagels, a choice of two cereals, juice, fresh fruit and good enough coffee. No room really to sit downstairs to enjoy the breakfast so most use the tray in the room to carry it back to the room. The hotel staff was in general friendly enough by New York standards. We had a problem with our toilet and this was dealt with promptly. Most people rave about the location and we must also throw our penny's worth in. It is absolutely true that you'll be hard pressed to find a better location for the price. In the heart of the theatre district, one block from restaurant row and Times Square. Across the street is a Duane Reade pharmacy for convenience shopping 24 hours a day. Another little gem is the Food Emporium two blocks north at 49th and 8th. We can really recommend them for a late night snack. Will we stay there again? Absolutely!! And in my opinion this is the measure of how great a hotel really was.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: clairv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is totally adequate but not luxurious in any way. As noted in prior postings, the rooms are SMALL, even by European standards. We had to squeeze by each other just to get to the bed. My husband hit his head on the low TV. But, everything worked fine, the bed was comfortable, the breakfast was fine as long as you took it up to your room to eat...........no seating in the lobby. And the location makes up for any deficiencies. Funny little things there, like you have to recode your room keys every day, and the elevator is, as mentioned before, quite slow. But so what.......the room was clean and comfortable and what more do you need in New York City. We stayed four nights and would return.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: fordwestvt
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in NYC and the hotel was very good. The staff was friendly, the location is good, the room and hallways were clean (but very small) and the price was reasonable for NYC. We paid about $160 plus tax.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Upstatefamily
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a Saturday night with my teenage daughter and her girlfriend. The room was small but we actually had the room we needed to iron and store shopping bags. The room was clean, nice tv, bathroom was very small but very clean. We appreciated the bottled water and chips and also the coffee/fruit in the lobby and the breakfast in the a.m. My only complaint is that we were in a corner room over 8th ave and heard all of the noise. Sirens, horns, voices well into the night - I would highly recommend ear plugs then I think you would be all set. For the price, this was a great place to stay - I really don't think you could do better. I paid under 200.00 with tax for a weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - clean, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: davewinst
Reviews.Content: Yes the room was small, yes there was nowhere to sit for breakfast and yes the lift was slow - overall though, the price and location far outweighed those negatives. The room was always clean, the showers powerful and hot, and 24hr coffee too! You couldn't have asked for a better location either - slap bang in the middle of the Theatre district and within walking distance of MoMA, Central Park, Empire State, Rockefeller Centre and Times Square. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room but will return”
Reviews.Author: Laura006
Reviews.Content: Yes, this was the tiniest room that we have ever stayed in (couldn't fit pass the desk and chair to get to the bed unless we removed the chair and stored it beside the desk and even then it was a tight squeeze. There was an ironing board and iron but I don't know if there would have been room to set it up. Now to the positives....the room was very clean...gleaming bathroom with great water pressure and temperature (unlike what others have described). The air conditioner worked fine. The flat screen tv had good reception and ample channels (couldn't get HBO to work though). There was a complimentary bottle of spring water and two bags of chips. The free continental breakfast included cereal, danish, croissants, bagels, juice and coffee. It was fresh and plentiful. We asked for extra towels and pillows and they were immediately brought up to our room. The staff was helpful and very, very friendly and of course the location was perfect. We were within walking distance of Port Authority and right in the middle of the theater district. The price for our midweek stay was under $200 night and booked directly through the hotel. If you can handle the small size of the room then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful (but loud!)”
Reviews.Author: YBandCamel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my girlfriend in April. On the plus side: The location was fanastic - you're a 3 minute walk from Times Square, right by the Subway and generally right in the heart of the tourist zone. The place is completely safe and clean. Breakfast was really good. I was at first disappointed not to see a toaster for the bagels, but it turned out they were so good you could just eat them untoasted. Despite reading about complaints on here, the lift was perfectly ok (by British standards). On the down side was the NOISE. Oh-my-god was it loud. We arrived on a Saturday night and the sound from the street in our 3rd floor room (people shouting, car horns honking every 2 minutes, and then of course the fire department...) was pretty much unbearable for the first hour or so trying to get to sleep. Luckily we had some earplugs which we used from that moment on throughout our stay which meant we slept absolutely fine after that, but i wouldnt recommend this place to a light sleeper. Apart from that it was fine. The bed was comfy, and the pillows were fine, the shower was hot and the TV worked.
