Of course the room was laughably small as described by everyone else on here but we were ready for that so it didnt bother us at all. Overall for the price of the room (and some earplugs), given the amazing location it was a bargain and I'd probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Too much for too little”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGal2008
Reviews.Content: If location is your only prerogative then yes, this hotel will meet your expectations, however if you are also interested in things like you know hot water, a chair to sit down on at breakfast, a quiet night's sleep - DO NOT book at Econo Lodge Times Square. During our short stay there we have heard so many people complaining about the water temperature (one guy was actually yelling at the concierge, that's how frustrated he was). The rooms are tiny, tiny - two people cannot pass by the beds when walking side by side. There were many front desk people that we've encountered during our stay there - some better than others. The good ones gave us tips on where to go to eat, brought more food when the continental breakfast area started emptying. In any case, if you have time to spare look around some more for other options before booking with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: MelodyBP
Reviews.Content: If you're not looking for anything fancy, this really is a great hotel at a great price. My 13-year old daughter and I stayed for 3 nights, and I'd highly recommend it. The location couldn't be better - close to everything. We always felt safe, even though it was just the two of us, even while walking back to the hotel at night from a nearby Broadway show one night and from Top of the Rock another. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was really good, and two of the three mornings we stayed, there was someone in the lobby standing by to make sure everything was stocked and that guests had everything they needed. Sure, the place is small, but so are most NYC hotels, and how much are you in the room other than when you're sleeping? The room was very clean, with ample space for the two of us and our luggage. A computer with internet access and printer was available in the lobby for a small fee, which was helpful since we were able to print our boarding passes for our return flight. The only negatives I can think of are that it's a bit noisy (lots of sirens since there's a nearby fire station), but hey, it's New York, right? Also, the elevator is old and not the fastest thing around, but was perfectly functional. Overall, a real value. We definitely would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: rubyslypperz
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just got back and will stay here when we go back to NYC! Inexpensive (got it for $159 on the hotel website), near everything, friendly staff, free breakfast, free USA Today at your door in the morning, room service response in 2 minutes, nice hard water pressure in shower, free chips and water in the room.........I could go on. The hotel is about 2 blocks off the bright lights and bustle of Times Square, but it was actually a quiet little residential area without a lot of outside noise. Breakfast was great : coffee, juice, tea, cocoa, oatmeal, croissants, bagels with cream cheese or jellies, danishes, muffins, cereals -- lots to pick from. No, there are not tables to eat at, we just brought the stuff back up to our room. They give you discount coupons for a great restaurant around the corner on Restaurant Row when you check in. The bed was comfortable. Yes, the room is tiny, but my daughter and I walked around in it just fine. What are you doing in your hotel room anyway, cartwheels?? Subway is a couple of blocks up and there are tons of restaurants all around. 24-hr Pharmacy right next door, just in case. The only thing negative that happened to us was no hot water one morning. We went out and about and did a few touristy things, came back 2 hours later and it was all fixed. Plus, there are many reviews that mention a slow elevator - we did not think so at all. Clean, comfy, good area (felt totally safe walking at night), good price. Thanks Econolodge!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Clean, and Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: chicklet036
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 3 nights at the Econo Lodge and it was by far the most for our money - and in NYC, you will need the extra money! The room was SMALL (10x10!) but the bed was big and very comfortable, and they made good use of the space. There was a small desk where we were able to store snacks that we brought. The TV was mounted on the wall, but easily viewed from the bed. There was a small armoire (we stored our luggage on top of it) with a few hangers and 2 drawers, and the safe was digital and free to use. There was a shelf above the sink in the bathroom to store cosmetics, and the shower was average-sized. The hotel was VERY clean! Our bed was made and our bathroom was cleaned and restocked every day. The free breakfast was also great - bagels, pastries, coffee, juice, oatmeal, hot chocolate, and fruit. However, there was no microwave or toaster. The staff was extremely pleasant. When we arrived, we found out that they charge to hold luggage - $3 per bag. They told us our room would probably be ready in an hour - so we decided to wait in the lobby - and our room was ready in 20 minutes! The elevator was slow, but they were doing maintenance on it when we left! The location couldn't be better! The only semi-negative thing I can say is that there is an Irish Pub/Bar directly across from the hotel and you can hear people all night (as well as traffic and sirens from the busy street around the corner) -- but, that's all part of the true NYC experience! I felt very safe and will definitely stay here again - the value can't be beat (AND you get breakfast!). However, I would recommend that only 1-2 people share a room. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location at a Fab price!”
Reviews.Author: Tappy Feet
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the positive Trip Advisor contributions. Everyone says that the location is FAB - and it is. It's only 2 blocks from Times Square; across the road you book Gray Line tours; it's just uptown from the Port Authority Bus Terminal. It's local to all theatres which was important to us as we were 2 women who wanted to see some shows and feel safe walking back to our hotel. It's in a safe area. Everyone says that the rooms are small - and they are. We took the advice of a previous contributor and booked a disabled room. I think it was a little larger but not by much. The hotel staff are helpful and friendly and the breakfast was always well supplied and topped up. We left one morning for a tour at 6am and breakfast was already available - although they did inform us the it opened at 7am. We were able to leave our luggage with them - $3 a bag - on the day of our departure as we had an evening flight. On the downside, we did find it to be in a noisy location. There were sirens all through the night; the pub opposite seemed to have a lot of very noisy patrons who always left in a loud manner; people came up the street with their stereo on full volume all night long. There was no way of blocking the sound as we were there when it was cold so putting on the noisy air con was not an option. I suggest ear plugs if you want a good nights sleep. By night 4, we were so tired that sleeping was easy even with the noise. We were very impressed with New Yorkers who we found to be approachable and helpful - not what we expected at all. The subways were very clean and we always felt safe. Unlike London subways which are hot and dirty all day long. I'd recommend this because it's a safe location for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Pisces77
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and the location fab! Although the rooms are on the smaller side the bed was very comfortable and it was exceptionally clean and tidy. The maids came in every day. If you are looking for a budget place to stay in NYC then this is it.... I mean why pay hundreds for your hotel room when there is so much to do in NY! Leone & Ryan - London

Reviews.Title: “Small, but no other complaints”
Reviews.Author: skgibbs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at Econo Lodge Times Square. Most of the reviews you read here are dead on. The hotel is really clean and the location is perfect for exploring NY. The hotel offers free bottled water and the continental breakfast has an above-average selection (bagels, muffins, danish, cereal, coffee, juice, etc.). The cons are a VERY small room and a VERY slow elevator. Hey, it is the ECONO lodge, what do you expect? For us, the hotel was well worth the $145 a night and the pros far outweighed the cons.

Reviews.Title: “Great but tiny”
Reviews.Author: RJ_70
Reviews.Content: Econo Lodge is in a fantastic location for exploring New York. Just 2 blocks from Times Square and a short walk from Rockerfeller Centre with hundreds of great restaurants within easy reach - you couldn't ask for a better location. However, the rooms are very small - the double bed all but filled it - so not much room for luggage, etc. Nevertheless, the bed was comfortable, there was a small wardrobe and desk in each room and a compact but functional bathroom with a good shower. Despite the location, noise wasn't a problem for us. We just kept the window shut and turned on the air con unit when the room got too hot at night (being March, this was as a result of the heating from the hotel, rather than the weather!) The rooms and corridors are kept clean and tidy, and a range of bagels, croissants, fruit, etc are served as the complementary breakfast, although there's no breakfast room, as such - just a few chairs in the lobby area. Having said that, there was always somewhere to sit while we were there. The staff was helpful and friendly and available round the clock. There's also internet access available in the lobby and somewhere to store your luggage for a few dollars on the day you check out. The only problem was that the lift is very slow, and occasionally ground to a halt with more than 4 passengers. Not good for those prone to claustrophobia! All in all a good little hotel in a fabulous location...and, after all, you won't be spending much time in your hotel room, will you? For the price, you'll struggle to find better in such a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Henny_van_Mulligen
Reviews.Content: We have spend a lovely holliday in the lodge. The people were very nice. The breakfast ok and we enjoyed the coffeemaker in the lounge. The room was small, But it was very clean and everything we needed was there. Thanks a lot for a very nice holliday. Greetings from the Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great price”
Reviews.Author: gluckbarchen
Reviews.Content: We just returned back to Scandinavia from this hotel. We stayed 5 nights in this adorable hotel. The hotels is average quality for Europeans and was a lot of better than I expected. The room is not that small as I expected, it is bigger than a cruise ship room. We had a room from the fourth floor. The hotel included free wireless internet (which worked pretty good), bag of snacks and local paper. The hotel has a great location, specially for tourists. The hotel was super clean. Only bad thing in this hotel was that sometimes in breakfeast table, there was nothing left anymore (eveh there should have been) and also the firestation across the street.(which can be pretty loud). We at least woke up at 5 am couple of times, because the firetrucks tend to use their loud horns instead of sirens, but hey, that is New York - bring your earplugs or headphones! Also that it got a bit cold sometimes in this hotel in March and they did not really have a "real blanket" so you have to sleep in a bit warmer clothes. Don't understand me wrong, those are only little things. When you want to visit New York and pay less for the hotel, you should book the hotel from Econo Lodge. Almost every hotel with 50-100 USD / fare / per day are around the same quality than this hotel. So don't bother to look better one :) I did that already for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!! Definately stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: Tigger89
Reviews.Content: ABSOLUTELY LOVED THIS HOTEL!! If you are having any doubts about staying here, dont have. It is a really good hotel for the price, excellent staff and fantastic location. Only one block from times square, and your on the street right next to all the major broadway shows!! starbucks is just across the street, 24hr pharmacy beside where you can get anything you need. Cant beat the location. I had to check into this hotel because the accomodation i had previously booked wasnt suitable. Although this hotel was very popular and almost all full, the staff found me a room and even gave me a room on the top floor (floor 6) when i requested it. They were all incredibly helpful and friendly. The hotel is very clean and beautifully decorated. There is 24hr complimentary tea and coffee at reception, and a gorgeous continential breakfast in the morning. 24hr internet access also available. The only negative side would be that the rooms are very tight, but u get what u pay for, and they were very clean!! The bathrooms are the same. There is also a safe in your room and a T.V. which shows around 30 channels, and you get complimentary crisps and bottled water in your room when you arrive. Also, in your room information book you get a 10% discount voucher for the gift shop right next door, which is great as the prices are already very good! As a young, single traveller i felt very safe here, and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I knew what I was getting into”
Reviews.Author: gatorphin
Reviews.Content: Yes I did. Or so I thought. Well I'm here to give you the stright up truth. No candy coating here. We arrived on a Friday night around midnight and had no trouble getting checked in to room 508. But, thre was one problem at check in. They couldn't give us our room key! The card reader was down and was supposed to be fixed the next day. OK, no problem. Got to our room. Yes, the elevator takes forever like everyone has stated. You could honestly walk up faster. The room is postage stamp size. Actually a similar size to a small cruise ship room. Barely enough room to go around the bed sideways. I'm not kidding. Oh well, knew that coming in too. Friend of mine in NY said that if your door doesn't hit your bed when you come in the room then you have a big room. LOL! But here's where I draw the line. So, it's around 1am and the wife & I turn down the sheets only to find the most horrible stains ever! Disgusting. So we had to sleep on top of the bed sheets since we were really tired and already showered. Next AM, told front desk and they changed them right away for us and gave us a discount card to a restaurant (we never went). Still no keys available. Also, window unit sounded like it was powered by hamsters. Too loud, had to shut off. Saturday night keys became available! But when we came back to the room Sunday we were locked out. Oh yeah, they forgot to tell us that everyday you have to have the room card rekeyed. No big deal if not for the turtle of an elevator they have. And then Sunday night got into the elevator with 3 other couples and got stuck in there for 10 minutes. Won't go up and won't open. Had to use emergency button and then it opened. Funniest thing was girl at counter who said "Oh you're all back down". LOL! No we never left! Hey for the $129 a night we paid I got what I expected. A bagel and coffee in the AM, a room I'd be livid with anywhere else but NYC, a great location, & a friendly staff. So I give it mixed reviews. Don't come expecting the Ritz. But if you just need a place to lay your head, take a shower, etc. then it's great. By the way, don't plan on bringing a lot of luggage. You won't have room to put it anywhere. Dos - Try Brazil Brazil restaurant, Beer House, go to Top of the Rock at night, see Wicked Don'ts - eat at Roxy Deli - very overrated, $47 for meat loaf sandwich and small pizza only, worry about safety - cops everywhere all the time, worry if you left something at home - drug store on the corner Have fun in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “A good deal”
Reviews.Author: BLynnS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights while in NY with friends. I was the only one who chose to stay here and I think I made the wisest choice. We all stayed in the Times Square area and the EconoLodge was one of the least expensive hotels. I found it to be clean, adequate, well located, and a good deal. Although the room was very small it was very clean; the TV and wireless worked well. I liked that there was a safe in the room. The continental breakfast was mostly grocery store bought pastries but the coffee, tea and fruit were good for getting out and about in the morning. I found the staff to be friendly and informative. Cabs were easy to get. I saw some other hotels rooms priced about the same and although they were larger the amenities I wanted (wireless, safe, breakfast) were missing. There was something funky going on with the hallwasy while I was there- wires and pipes sticking out in odd places.

Reviews.Title: “Small Value”
Reviews.Author: HouTraveler
Reviews.Content: Nothing new to add on the size - rooms are minuscule. Nothing in Times Square comes close to this value, however. Be aware it is not plush at all - it's the kind of place with worn wallpaper, where hallway door slams reach your room and you hear sirens and street noise all night long (get as high a floor as possible). That said, who goes to NYC to stay in their room, so we will stay again. Bring earplugs and enjoy the city while saving money.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jbauer1210
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took a spur of the moment trip to NYC in May and stayed here. The hotel is in an excellent location, close to transportation, Times Square and restaurants and shops. The staff was friendly and helpful, continental breakfast was great, the room was clean. The only downside was the tiny, tiny room. But, you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: tobyv420
Reviews.Content: The econolodge provides free wi-fi internet access, free continental breakfast. The room was very clean. The only downside was that the room was only about 8ft. by 8ft. so it mad it difficult with the luggage, however there was a luggage stand that made it more convenient. The shower worked perfectly and had very good pressure, i actually liked it better than my shower at home. The hotel is only a minute away from time square if you walk. There is a subway station only 5 minutes walk. I nice hotel especially for the price. Maybe the only hotel this cheap that offers continental breakfast and a clean private room with bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pedidik
Reviews.Content: My sister and I visited New York last week to see all the Christmas Decorations. After much research we chose this hotel basically because of the price, but it turned out to be the best location and the friendliest staff. The room was a bit small but very clean. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: kirbey38
Reviews.Content: Room looked exactly as seen on this site, so don't be suprised by how TINY the room is, it is very, very small. It was myself and my mom, and we both could not walk in the room at the same time, despite the tiny space, the room and bathroom was immaculate, we even noticed our sheets were changed daily, you don't find that too often. The staff from the young lady that checked us in, to the housekeepers, to the young man that retrieved our bags on our last day, to the security man were all very pleasant, and all voiced their willingness to do what they could to make our stay special. The location is AWSOME! You are in walking distance to all of Times Square, 15 minute walk to Central Park, 10 minute walk to Rockerfellar Center, and 5th Ave, and subway station 5 minute walk. The only draw back was we visited with temps outside around 28 degrees, even colder with wind chill, and although we welcomed a warm room, being a small space, it became too hot and stuffy most nights, as we were unable to control our own heat. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bjgtravelbug
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend in NYC and enjoyed our stay at Econo Lodge very much. We arrived earlier than expected and hoped they would just hold our bags for us, but they told us that if we could wait 15 minutes they would have our room ready and they did. The staff was very helpful with our many tourist questions and directions. The location was fine for walking to our Broadway Show (we saw The Color Purple and it was GREAT!) There are good places to eat and buy souveniers right next door. We really liked Carve (across the street on 8th) they have good pizza, sandwiches and desserts at really good prices. I'm not a big fan of continental breakfasts and Carve had a great breakfast sandwich for around $3. We knew about the small rooms from the reviews on this website, so we were prepared for that and it wasn't a big deal. We had 3 people in our room and it was tight, but we were only there to sleep and shower. We are very grateful to the staff for holding our luggage for us on our last day. We checked out on a Saturday morning to go to Connecticut to visit family and when we came back to the city the next day we had nowhere to store our bags. One quick call to the Econo Lodge and our problem was solved. They held the bags for us all day for $3 per bag. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler027
Reviews.Content: Very small room, but 1 block from Time Square. Very, very clean and the shower pressure was great. For a 1 or two night stay with no more then two people, I would do it again. Staff was very nice. Just a perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “small but clean”
Reviews.Author: dmg2
Reviews.Content: I've read reviews of this hotel before and the overall comment was that they are small rooms....let me say they are VERY small rooms. But they are clean, and the water pressure is great. The elevators are slow though. The breakfast is adequate. The location is AWESOME! And the staff is super friendly. It's right near a drug store too! And not far from the subway - and across the street from Greyline. Honestly, although the rooms are VERY small (no closet - but a dresser where you can hang things, and an ironing board), the beds are comfy. Oh, there are window air conditioning units. And the street noises can be a bit loud at times. Here's the deal....if you are looking for a reasonable hotel rate in NYC and don't plan on hanging in your room, this is the place for you! (and I'm a picky hotel person!)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice staff.. very small”
Reviews.Author: Kayak126
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on Oct. 4th: Pros: Very Nice Staff Location, location, location, location Nice Price Clean rooms Good continental breakfast Coffee 24 hours per day comfortable beds Cons: Postage stamp size rooms very slow elevator

Reviews.Title: “I Love NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Toronto5
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Econolodge Times Square last September for 3 nights. We loved the location ... it was less than a 5 minute walk to everything. (i.e Times Square, TKTS, broadway theatres, Restaurant row) .. the subway is a short walk away ... the hotel is located on 47th st. just north of 8th Ave ... times square is on 7th ave.. so the location is PERFECT. It isnt too loud at all ... the rooms are quite small .. very tight and no room to walk around, just enough for the bed, a small desk, and the washroom .. but it didnt matter .. cuz we werent there for the room ... its clean and upgraded so its great. The free continental breakfast was really good and really saved us some money ... which helped with the more expensive dinners and bar (Blue Fin in Times Square) we went to. We watched Hairspray and Beauty and the Beast ... both wonderful!). Shopping is great and subway pretty easy to use. I also went to NYC a few months earlier and stayed somewhere else (on 10th Ave.) and the room was alot bigger, but further away from the action. Anyway, we love it there and are going again this October for 2 nights and we staying at the Econolodge again. I will post photos on my next review. I can't wait. I love NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably loud”
Reviews.Author: Steve1112
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably loud because of bad window/AC design. The window is open to accommodate the AC unit, and cardboards are placed around the AC unit so wind doesn't blow into the room. Needless to say, cardboards do not filter noise, so the experience is as if you were literally on the street. This is pretty outrageous considering the hotel is located on Times Square, which is pretty noisy day in, day out. It is even more outrageous considering that there is a bar right across the street that plays jazz till 4AM. I called the hotel staff to complain, and they told me that it was normal, and that I should live with it. If I didn't have earplugs, I wouldn't have slept at all. Secondly, the bed sheets had big black stains on them, which I realized when I was about to go to sleep. When I complained about this to the hotel staff, they sent someone that handed me new sheets. The new sheets had the same stains, and that person told me that there was no housecleaning service at night and that I was supposed to replace the bedding myself. He left, and while replacing the bedding I realized that the new sheets he gave me were in fact small for my bed! I was too tired to complain again. In summary, I went there because of the good reviews, only to be very disappointed. I will not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages!”
Reviews.Author: DW111
Reviews.Content: We'd seen the reviews which mentioned the small rooms, and small our room was. However we had everything we needed! and as somebody else said, we hadn't gone to New York to stay in our room. The room was clean and tidy and everything worked. Breakfast was better than we anticipated, held in the small lobby. Staff were very helpful and friendly, and the location of the hotel is excellent. We would happily stay there again, and the next time we visit New York we probably will. Good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to everyone for posting the prior information”
Reviews.Author: Futurejumps
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone for posting the prior information. Here is my information to help future guests: A 24-Hour Drug store is across the street (get a store card for extra savings). Try the fresh fruit cart stand on the corner. We enjoyed having fruit for snacks. We had two rooms for our family of four but I still had to go to the lobby to enjoy my laptop since the rooms are so small â€“ Tiny Rooms! But, the staff was very helpful. We saw 2 plays (Color Purple & Forbidden Broadway). The Theater that showed Forbidden Broadway was right next door to our hotel. I talked to a theater employee just before the show and got discount tickets. We decided not to pay $600 for the four of us to see the Lion King. Our only regret was that we did not eat at any of the restaurants at restaurant row on 46th Street (directly around the corner). We eat at the major restaurants with the higher NYC prices for same food that we could have had at home. Again, we should have tried something different since we were already paying higher prices for food in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Perfect location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: kshaugh
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed out stay at the Econo Lodge. It was the perfect location to do all of the tourist-y type things in NYC. Yes, the room was small - but it was cozy, clean, cool and comfortable. We were literally only there to sleep and we zonked out each night! Great water pressure in the shower, the breakfast was a great way to start off the day and the front desk service was fast, courteous and knowledgeable. Don't miss all of the great restaurants on 46th - known as Restaurant Row. Much better than the chains you find in Times Square. If I were going to do all of the tourist-y things again in NYC - I would stay here again in a HEARTBEAT. However, if you are looking for more of a true NYC living experience - spend more for a place in SoHo or Greenwich.

Reviews.Title: “As before, great location/great staff”
Reviews.Author: sasyhu1
Reviews.Content: Yes, rooms are small but cozy for 2 people. Clean comfortable and updated. The 'white' noise of the air conditioner drowns out most of the street noise, so I didn't find that a problem. Temperature was easily controlled. And the best part, close to theatres. Easily within walking distances of many attractions and restaurants. Suffice to say, how nice is it to be able to walk back to your hotel room and rest for a bit before continuing the day. The staff friendly, and helpful. Breakfast was nice but with so many unique eateries close by, why bother? But it's nice to be able to grab a coffee/orange juice though. Coffee 24/7. Starbucks in right across the street. Free Wi-Fi is a nice touch also, daily charges for wifi add up quickly. There is 1 stand for a suitcase, so my suitcase had to stay on the floor. Really, there's not room for 2 suitcases. But I didn't mind, better the wife to be happy and for all you couples you know what I mean. Flat screen TV is nice, tucked above and out of the way. But if you travel to NYC, who watches TV anyway (oh wait, weather channel). Armoire is small, so make sure most of your clothes are folded as not to wrinkled. But there is an abbreviated ironing board and iron, nice touch. Overall, I would stay here again. Good price, great location, friendly staff. Easy to access subways, buses, bicycle taxis, taxis. Elevator, bring a book to read. Slow. I was on the 5th floor. But walking stairs is great exercise so not a problem. Bathroom is akin to an average house hallway full bath, not large but not overty tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: Logibear_7
Reviews.Content: Yes, this room was small, but you are not in the room very much. We had an excellent stay here. The room and hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly. Just one block away from Time Square,which makes it very convenient. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: terrytoons
Reviews.Content: I quite liked my stay at the Econo Lodge Times Square, especially since affordable rooms were hard to find for the week I was in NYC. But I wouldn't stay here with someone else. The rooms are tiny -- perfect for a solo traveler who's not planning to spend oodles of time in the hotel, but it seems to me it would be unbearable with two people in the room. My room was spotless, the bed was comfy, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect for a tourist -- close to subways, a 24-hour Duane Reade, and of course, a Starbucks. And blessedly, the air conditioning worked perfectly! I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, unless I was looking for a room for two.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy tiny cruise ship rooms? You'll love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior-Houston
Reviews.Content: If you look at a photo of a room online, remember: the camera always adds ten pounds! This room is literally the size of the bed plus a foot on each side and nine inches at the foot of the bed. There is no closet, only a cupboard barely large enough for children's clothes. No room for large luggage. You have to stand right by the door to get dressed because it's the only spot where you can actually turn around while standing. My husband and I had to take turns stepping away to let the other pass to move anywhere. Yes, it's clean. Yes, the staff is nice. Yes, it's a block from Times Square. But, unless you're 1) alone, 2) with no hanging clothes or sizeable luggage, and 3) VERY thin, this may not be the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomMidwest
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Econo Lodge twice in the last couple of months. It offers clean, safe lodging, in a location central to the theatre district and many NYC sights. Several subway lines are within easy walking distance. The rooms indeed are very tiny, even by New York standards. However, the rooms I've had have been very clean, and the furnishings and TV were newer and in good repair. The front desk staff have been super friendly and helpful. Both times I was able to get an early check-in with only a short wait. Water and snacks (small bags of chips) are provided in the rooms and I was offered free replacements upon request. The continental breakfast is served in a small area in the small lobby, but the selections covered all the basics and included some really good pastries. Wireless internet is free, generally available, but sometimes very low speed. All in all, a good choice for those wanting safe, clean, central accomodations at a reasonable price for New York.

Reviews.Title: “what you read here is true”
Reviews.Author: snippet_sf
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 2 nights at the Econolodge Times Square and read all of the comments about this hotel (good and bad). I must say they are all pretty accurate from the small rooms to slow elevator to friendly desk staff, etc. The comments about the scary bar across the street and bad area at night are not true. Both were perfectly fine. I stayed here for the price and that is what you'll need to keep in mind during your stay. The bed and the bathroom were clean (the carpet wasn't so nice), but they weren't luxurious by any means.This is truly a room you sleep and shower in and then leave (especially if there are two of you). And yes, Times Square and most of the theaters are only a block away. The hotel is at 47th and there are subway stops at 50th and 42nd. Lastly, we didn't know it till the last day of our stay, but 46th street one block down is called "Restaurant Row" (on the street sign). It's filled with the most amazing restaurants--if you like food you should go there. Go to --- to check it out!! I'd stay here again, but only for the price. If I could get something better for the same rate I take it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Bargain Find!”
Reviews.Author: MaltaBound
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated only 1 1/2 blocks from Times Square...what a perfect location. ...and close to the subways in two directions. Please note that all hotel rooms (sans the $500.00 ones) in New York City are small and this is no exception. Nevertheless, the room was spotlessly clean (only 2 years old we think), had a plasma TV, USA Today paper delivered daily, and included a free breakfast. The breakfast was a stepped up continental: cereal, local fresh made bagels and butter croissants (not the stale packaged ones), other pastry delights, hot cereal, and fruit. PLus, the fruit (nice afternoon snack), coffee, & tea were there 24 hrs a day. What distinguished this property from other NYC hotels is that the hotel staff went overboard to assist: bottled water whenever we needed it at no charge, directions, etc. All in all, we enjoyed our stay due to the friendliness and price of this hotel. We recommend it without reservations after reading about other NYC hotels with rats, bedbugs, etc. We didn't even see one bug!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie2521
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, I braced myself for the small room and it was as I expected it! However, the two of us quickly got over that and enjoyed our stay here. The room was very clean and was laid out well. The staff was efficient and friendly. One of the front desk staff even offered to walk over to 8th avenue to hail us a taxi after we told her of the problems we had getting one. During our 4 day & 3 night stay we never had a problem with the elevator as it came promptly. The complimentary breakfast was awesome with nice and ample choices of bagels, pound cake, fruit, juices, coffee & tea. I highly recommend this hotel for up to 2 people per room who will be doing a bunch of out-of-room activities! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: xcstar185
Reviews.Content: this place was great. Whether you're a tourist looking to see the whole city or just there for a night in manhattan, it's a great hotel to stay at. the rooms are really small, but very tidy. The location is amazing, centrally located and right next to times square! the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. i would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: syblewright
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful! The staff went out of the way to help us. My Father is in a wheelchair and its hard for him to get around, but the staff was so considerate and helpful for us. Anything we needed they did. We stayed 4 nights, and not one night do I have anything negative to say!I've been all over the United States and have never felt so pleased. Yes, the rooms were small, but what are you looking for?? your home?? not going to happen. It's located near everything you could ever want to see or need. Thank You to the staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fishinal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful.... great location great location and clean clean clean.. the staff were more than helpful with directions etc. I would highly recommend this hotel, price is great and the hotel is very clean.. I don't think you'll find a better bargain in this city... I will be back.. only drawback the rooms are very small as stated..not much room to move, however, we spent all out time on the streets, it was perfect for us..

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on West 47th Street”
Reviews.Author: gl0betrotter
Reviews.Content: I used to read the stories about other peopleâ€™s nightmarish travel experiences with a certain amount of indifference, but after my recent stay at the Econo Lodge at Time Square in NYC, Iâ€™ve definitely developed a lot more compassion for those individuals. Through all of my travels and stays at hotels, I have never experienced such a complete disregard for customers and their needs, and the worse part it was that although Iâ€™d tried to reach the manager of the hotel, Ronica, throughout my stay, each time, I was given a response that she hadnâ€™t arrived at work (this being 10:00am on Friday morning) or that sheâ€™d already left (at 4:30pm on the same day), and when Iâ€™d asked whether she would be in during the weekend, the receptionist only responded by telling me that â€œShe doesnâ€™t really have a fixed schedule.â€�

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: tipsytravler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in queen room on 2nd floor. Very tiny but tolerable. Half the size of a cruise ship cabin and then add a bathroom. Location is awesome, price was great ($115 per night). Property is super clean. Breakfast is grab and go but fresh and free. Downside- the room was like a sauna. We had the window open and the air conditioner on. Asked front desk to turn down heat (you cannot control it from your room) never seemed to happen. You would think in March "too hot" wouldn't be an issue. Friends had corner room with 2 doubles, a bit more room and cooler due to three windows. Not recommended for menopausal women!!!! Everyone else should do ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Modest Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: BuceriasBoy
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best values in New York for the budget conscious. You can't beat the location, and the staff is unusually friendly and helpful. The hotel is very clean, but the rooms are laughably small. The queen size bed took up my entire room. The staff seems to be quite security conscious, which is a good thing in NYC. I regularly travel to New York to see theater, and this is my new favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: homebody00
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for someone visiting New York and just looking for a bed and shower (because that is basically all it is). As many reviews pointed out the rooms are VERY small. My husband and I wanted to stretch after a jog and had to take turns due to lack of space. However, we paid $116 per night with AAA discount and were very happy with what we got. The room was clean (including the bathroom), looked recently updated, and functional. There was a free continental breakfast which was sparse, but we were able to save time by grabbing some oatmeal in the lobby in the morning. Very quick walk to Times Square, Broadway theaters, and loads of restaurants. Highly recommended for New York travelers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: KelleyA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value for money with a continental buffet style breakfast included in the price - great for starting out in the morning. Tea, fresh coffee and hot drinks are provided in reception 24 hours a day. Reception staff at the hotel were excellent, extremely friendly and helpful. As pointed out in other reviews the hotel rooms really are TINY! This isn't too much of a problem on a short stay as we spent very little time in our room. We stayed four nights and as we acquired goodies from various shopping trips space became a bit tight , but we managed. The bathroom is again small, if you are of large stature you will struggle! Nevertheless it was very clean with fresh towels and toiletries provided daily. The shower was powerful with plenty of hot water available. The location of the hotel is fantastic and we found we could walk to most places of interest , Times Square, Rockerfeller Centre, Theatre District, Maceys, Empire State, Madison Square Gardens, Central Park. As others have mentioned this location comes at a price! It is very noisy at night with sirens and car horns being sounded well into the small hours so bring your earplugs or make sure you have a large night cap! There are a few negatives with this hotel however it is all about compromise. Yes it is noisy at night, yes the rooms are very small, however, the staff are friendly and helpful, the location is fantastic, for a hotel in the centre of everything the rates are very good! If you don't mind a bit of noise, can cope with a small room, want to be in the centre of everything but not pay a fortune this is the place for you. We had a great time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cheap by NY standards”
Reviews.Author: amiprice
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in October for two nights. Pros: - Cheap, by NYC standards - Location is good - Continental breakfast in the lobby is great for grabbing and running - Front desk staff were very nice - No bad experiences to report - Small armoire to hang clothes and small shelf in the bathroom for toiletries - Flat screen TV on wall works well to save space - A/C worked well Cons: - Room is the size of a shoebox. It's so tiny you just have to laugh - No room to walk around in room. Had to climb over the bed - Elevators slow and small - Had to pay to store bags for the afternoon upon checkout I suppose I'd stay here again if it was just for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: AdrianK
Reviews.Content: Good budget hotel, compact & clean room with reasonable bathroom. Continental breakfast was included in the price. Location on corner of 8th Avenue and 47th Street is excellent for restaurants (can recommend Da Rosina - Italian, in 46th Street) and close to Broadway/Times Square etc. Just one thing - take your ear plugs, as rooms are noisy due to the traffic on 8th and New Yorkers love of their car horns.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rodrigoturist
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! great location, rooms were clean, location was great, and the price was good taking into account the location.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a scam!”
Reviews.Author: jandrew
Reviews.Content: Okay, so i finally figured it - this place is a scam - I called the hotel up directly to book a weekend for my wife and I - we are huge econo lodge fans for staying in expensive places like the big apple - but this one needs to be checked out by the franchise - when i called to book the room they said they had a room for the weekend and quoted me a price - when i said i would check on-line - the price immediately dropped - so i checked while still on the phone and sure enough they had a room for about $85 less per night - when I kept on hounding the desk clerk - she said it was the same room but the owners told her to keep rooms a side so that they dont have to pay any franchise tax to the franchise - she offered to book me at the lower rate and told me that when i got their to even ask for a lower price if I paid cash - WHAT KINDA PLACE DOES THAT?

HotelInfo.Name: Econo Lodge Times Square
HotelInfo.Address: 302 West 47th Street, New York City, NY 10036
